title: Warburton brings in Valente as Seven CMO
text:
"Charlie helped me drive a lot of change at APN ... really driving that through the company as we moved from asset-led to audience-led," Mr Warburton said.

"It’s about fresh thinking and new ideas. We’re doing a number of things very very well, but we’ve been way too inward-looking.

"You’ve seen with the change in structure. We’ve had too many layers, we’ve had too much process and we’ve been way too inward-looking in terms of producing our own content, the way in which we go to market.

"This is about having a completely fresh view."

More appointments coming

Ms Valente, who will join Seven on October 21, is Mr Warburton's first major executive appointment following his return to Seven in August, when he took over from former chief executive Tim Worner. She will be one of eight direct reports to Mr Warburton after he slashed the number of divisions reporting to him last week from 17.

Also reporting to Mr Warburton are chief revenue officer Kurt Burnette, commercial director Bruce McWilliam, chief financial officer Warwick Lynch, chief people and culture officer Katie McGrath and Seven West Australia chief executive Maryna Fewster.

Seven is about to appoint a chief digital officer and is also looking for a chief content officer.

Seven's strong performance in news, AFL and morning television has kept its share of total ratings for 2019 at a healthy level, but it has taken a hit in the valuable 7.30pm prime-time slot, Mr Warburton said.

"While we’ve lost a bit of momentum in our 7.30 schedule, at least the content we’re putting to air in October is much more back to stuff you can feel proud about in terms of Seven – Secret Bridesmaids' Business, Bride & Prejudice and Dirty Dancing," Mr Warburton said.

"But we’ve launched those programs at a time when the others, particularly Nine, has had The Block in market for a long period of time, and other than a couple of hours a week where Ten have been beating us with The Masked Singer ... we’re still incredibly strong through all the demographics in the last couple of weeks."

Mr Warburton will unveil Seven's major programming changes, shows and strategy for 2020 later this month. He has said he wants to retire old formats, target new demographics, bring Seven's average viewer age down and launch new shows more effectively – projects in which the new CMO will have a key role.
description: James Warburton has given his former APN Outdoor colleague a wide brief across Seven's portfolio.
